summary: primary healthcare, including mental healthcare, was ignored by the medical service. patients with a mental illness were invisible, other than if they murdered someone or did some other awful act in the neighbourhood. the pathway from community-based care to tertiary care was not well-established. trials of integration in psychiatric hospitals in china are underway. one is trying to lead psychiatric institutions to extend their service into the communities. it has been estimated that only 8% have ever sought professional help. the transition from hospital-based mental health services to primary care services in the most populous country in the world is certainly a tough job. the transition from hospital-based mental health services to primary care services in the most populous country in the world is certainly a tough job.
